caseTitle: MISCELLANY-AT-LAW TRIBUTE TO THE LATE MRS JANET DANIELS, FIR
summary: This document is a memorial tribute to Mrs Janet Daniels, Barrister-at-law and the first Editor of the Review of Ghana Law, who passed away on 20 January 1991. She served for sixteen years in legal publishing, beginning as Assistant Editor of the Ghana Law Reports in 1965 and becoming the inaugural Editor of the Review of Ghana Law in 1969. Her work significantly advanced legal scholarship and the administration of justice in Ghana. Hon. Mr Justice Apaloo praised her role in fostering critical legal analysis. The tribute, delivered by her successor S.Y. Bimpong-Buta, highlights her editorial excellence, dedication, and authorship of influential legal articles. The Council for Law Reporting honored her legacy and extended condolences to her family.
rationaleHighlights: Mrs Janet Daniels made invaluable contributions to Ghanaian legal publishing
She was foundational in establishing the Review of Ghana Law as a premier legal journal
Her editorial rigor elevated legal discourse in Ghana
She authored key legal articles on statute law, jury trials, and defamation
Her work supported the development of Ghanaian jurisprudence
confidenceNotes: The document is a tribute rather than a judicial decision, so standard legal citations are limited. 'RGL' refers to Review of Ghana Law.
